caption:
This aerial photograph captures a lush and expansive landscape that is dominated by the natural surroundings and features some human development. The scene is characterized by its dense forests and patches of cleared areas, showcasing a blend of developed and natural elements.

In the lower part of the image, there is a cluster of buildings, probably a small residential or rural community, surrounded by fields and patches of tree lines. There is a distinct clearance around the structures, creating an organized, landscaped appearance, with neatly aligned trees and cleared paths or roads. The area suggests typical rural land use, possibly for small-scale agriculture or residential purposes.

A major road stretches diagonally from the lower left to the middle of the image, dividing the forested areas from the more developed sections. This road is broad and well-defined, providing vital connectivity through this verdant landscape.

The middle and upper parts of the image are predominantly forested, with dense collections of evergreen trees that cover vast areas. The texture of the trees indicates they are mature, suggesting an old forest. Few small clearings interrupt the green expanse, possibly for utility or access purposes.

In the far distance, the photograph extends to a breathtaking view of a calm body of water, likely a lake or a wide river, bordered further by mountain ranges whose peaks are faintly visible against the horizon. These mountains add a dramatic backdrop to the serene landscape pictured in the foreground, emphasizing both the natural beauty and the remote setting of the area.

Overall, the photograph portrays a tranquil panorama that balances human habitation with nature, capturing the essence of a rural or possibly suburban landscape against a stunning mountainous setting, emphasizing the sprawl and diversity of land use in such regions.
title: Aerial view looking southwest with clear creek road north of the navy's Bangor annex with the main gate in the foreground annex administration buildings are at the left center of the photo the hood canal and the olympic mountains are in the background this area will be the site of the trident submarine base or the u.s navy.  The expected population growth will affect the humans and the animals who presently live there
